TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AutomationProperty extends System.Windows.Automation.AutomationIdentifier

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class identifies properties, not the values of properties. Static objects of this type are found as fields of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> and control pattern classes.
## Examples The following example adds a property-changed event handler, and the handler checks the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationPropertyChangedEventArgs.Property%2A> member of the event arguments to determine the property that has been changed.
[!code-cs[UIAClient_snip#172](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/CustomElementClient/PropertySnips.cs#172)] [!code-vb[UIAClient_snip#172](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/UIAClient_snip/PropertySnips.vb#172)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperty LookupById(int32 id) cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves an that encapsulates a specified numerical identifier.
Docs.returns: Retrieves an that encapsulates a specified numerical identifier.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Normally, properties are identified by an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperty> object. This method can be used to create such an object when only the numerical identifier (the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationIdentifier.Id%2A> inherited from <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationIdentifier>) is known.
